rSMEAx-y3.memHandModelNotes: Within NC this snake has only been recorded from elevations below 610m (Palmer & Braswell 1995).  Found in more open woodland and ectone environments use Edge Parameter.  Ecotone width based on size/mobility ratio, no home range information available in literature.  Amy Silvano 29Aug05

rSMEAx-y5.memHandModelNotes: Within NC this snake has only been recorded from elevations below 610m (Palmer & Braswell 1995).  Found in more open woodland and ectone environments use Edge Parameter.  Ecotone width based on size/mobility ratio, no home range information available in literature.  Amy Silvano 29Aug05

habitat_description:
Populations of the smooth earthsnake are found from New Jersey, Pennsylvania, southern Iowa, northern Florida, eastern Oklahoma, northeastern Kansas, and central Texas (Conant and Collins 1991; Ernst and Ernst 2003; Powell et al. 1992). 

This species is described to burrow in soil or using soil and decaying vegetation among riparian areas and a wide variety of terrestrial habitats. During the day, this species is most likely taking cover under rocks or logs. The habitat is mainly characterized by exposed rocky slopes in mixed deciduous pine associations; mesic hammocks, woodlands among floodplains, wooded areas that surround marshes, cropland, shrubland, vacant lots, old fields, and even in brushy or wooded residential areas and suburban orchard settings.
